I've been going through the Verus options and I'm not entirely sure what they do. Can you help me out with the OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER option?

The OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER option, set to 1024, determines the behavior of gateway name and currency registration. What is the purpose of the OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER option in Verus?

The OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER option, set to 1024, determines the behavior of gateway name and currency registration. When this option is not set on a gateway, the top-level ID and currency registration occur on the launch chain.

ill publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
What does the OPTION_NFT_TOKEN option do in Verus?

The OPTION_NFT_TOKEN option, set to 2048, enables the creation of a single satoshi NFT (non-fungible token) that tokenizes control over the root ID. This allows for unique, indivisible, and verifiable ownership of the root ID.

OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
